author: TOI Tech Desk
title: Verizon Outage hits Keene and nearby areas: Here's what the company said - The Times of India
text:
Verizon users in Keene and surrounding areas are experiencing widespread service outages. The issue started after a network failure which began early Wednesday morning. According to DownDetector, the outage started around 9.10 AM and has affected mobile data, voice calls, text messaging and wireless home internet services offered by Verizon. Due to the outage the Verizon users in the southwestern New Hampshire region are left without reliable cellular and data services. The DownDetector data reveals that due to the ongoing outage 54% users are facing issues with mobile phone, 24% are experiencing no signal and 22% are unable to access 5G home internet. While Keene is among the hardest hit, other cities such as New York, Atlanta, and Pittsburgh have also seen elevated outage reports Verizon outage: What the company said
The Verizon support page shows that the telecom operator is working on a fix. The company has also activated its standard outage notification system to keep affected customers informed of repair progress. Verizon engineers have been working since mid-morning Wednesday to diagnose and resolve the issue. Initial repair estimates were pushed back after crews discovered additional complications. Verizon has advised users to enable Wi-Fi calling on their smartphones to maintain communication while the cellular network remains down. This feature allows calls and texts to be routed through Wi-Fi networks instead of relying on mobile signals. Verizon has not released detailed information about the root cause of the outage, following the company's typical practice of focusing on repair efforts rather than providing extensive technical explanations. About the Author TOI Tech Desk The TOI Tech Desk is a dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant news from the world of technology to readers of The Times of India. TOI Tech Deskâ€™s news coverage spans a wide spectrum across gadget launches, gadget reviews, trends, in-depth analysis, exclusive reports and breaking stories that impact technology and the digital universe. Be it how-tos or the latest happenings in AI, cybersecurity, personal gadgets, platforms like WhatsApp, Instagram, Facebook and more; TOI Tech Desk brings the news with accuracy and authenticity. author: SnowBrains
title: Skier Killed in Soft Slab Avalanche on Denali, AK
text:
Denali as seen from the Reflection Pond. | Picture: National Park Services A skier was confirmed dead after being caught in a soft slab avalanche from below the Rescue Gully above Camp 14 on Denali, Alaska. The slide occurred on the West Buttress Route at approximately 6:15 p.m. on June 10. Nicholas Vizzini, age 29 of Washington State, and his climbing partner, a snowboarder, triggered the avalanche while descending the slope.
According to the report by National Park Services , two mountaineering rangers on an acclimatization climb spotted the partner on the surface of the avalanche debris and were able to respond within minutes. After a quick assessment of the partner, a beacon search was initiated and a signal acquired. During the search, Vizzini was visually located and found to be mostly buried in the debris. The rangers immediately began digging to establish an airway. CPR was initiated but discontinued after forty minutes due to traumatic injuries and no pulse.
The soft slab avalanche on Denali, Alaska. | Picture:National Park Services After recovery, rangers flew the body to Talkeetna, where they transferred it to the state medical examiner. Vizziniâ€™s partner sustained minor injuries and is scheduled to fly off the mountain today.
Rescue Gully starts at 17,200 feet on the West Buttress route. The top of where the avalanche released was approximately 16,600 feet and the avalanche ran down to approximately 15,000 feet.
This is the second death on Denali this climbing season. On June 4, Alex Chiu, aged 41 of Seattle, Washington, died as a result of a 3,000-foot fall from the Denali West Buttress climbing route on to the Peters Glacier.
This marks the 23rd avalanche related death of the 2024-25 hydrological season, which runs from October 1, 2024, to September 30, 2025. There have been approximately 13 avalanche-related deaths and more than 130 total deaths on the mountain recorded in the history of the park. There are currently 500 climbers on the mountain.
The climbing season on Denali is rather short and typically begins in early May and ends in early July.

author: Shannon K. Crawford and Jesse Convertino
title: Sweden officially joins NATO after delayed process, ending longstanding military neutrality
text:
(NEW YORK) -- Sweden's arduous path to joining the NATO alliance came to a successful close Thursday, as the Swedish prime minister and foreign minister deposited the country's "instrument of accession" at the State Department in Washington.
In a lighthearted ceremony, Secretary of State Antony Blinken posed for photos with Swedish Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson, with the two holding a blue folder containing the document. Blinken quipped, "Well, good things come to those who wait."
"With receipt of this instrument of accession, let me be the very first to welcome Sweden as a party to the Washington Treaty and the 32nd member of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization," Blinken continued.
Blinken remarked on Sweden's longstanding military neutrality, and how the country was moved to end its tradition after Russian President Vladimir Putin invaded Ukraine in 2022. Sweden was called to defend democracy and recognized the existential threat Russia's aggression presented to European nations, he said.
"None of this was easy, none of this was obvious," Blinken said, adding it had taken "nearly two years of tireless diplomacy" to add Sweden to the alliance.
"Sweden is now a NATO member," Kristersson said on X earlier. "Thank you all Allies for welcoming us as the 32nd member. We will strive for unity, solidarity and burden-sharing, and will fully adhere to the Washington Treaty values: freedom, democracy, individual liberty and the rule of law. Stronger together."
Sweden's membership had been slowed by objections from Turkey and Hungary. The U.S. was able to eventually incentivize Turkey by approving the sale of fighter jets to the country, and Hungary signed off on Sweden's addition this week.
"This is a historic day," NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg said in a statement. "Sweden will now take its rightful place at NATO's table, with an equal say in shaping NATO policies and decisions. After over 200 years of non-alignment Sweden now enjoys the protection granted under Article 5, the ultimate guarantee of Allies' freedom and security. Sweden brings with it capable armed forces and a first-class defense industry."
Sweden's flag will be raised alongside those of the other 31 Allies in a ceremony at NATO headquarters in Brussels on March 11 and simultaneously at NATO commands across Europe and North America, NATO said.

author: Mark Mansfield
title: Playing a dangerous game
text:
Opinion
Playing a dangerous game
Ben Wildsmith
If you visit the House of Commons to sit in the public gallery, they hand you a leaflet that emphasises the majesty of the procedure you are witnessing. The â€˜mother of parliamentsâ€™, it tells you, is the cradle of modern democracy and the gold standard for government of and by the people.
The tone of the leaflet suggests that itâ€™s aimed at foreign tourists, which is just as well, because anybody living in the UK would be well within their rights in reporting our parliamentary mother to social services.
Firstly, to get it out of the way, having a king is plainly at odds with democratic values. Abolishing the monarchy, though, requires more than tweeting #notmyking 23 times a day and buying a Guy Fawkes mask.
Youâ€™re paying for him, so until you organise a revolution, he #isyourking.
Independence
Similarly, independence might bring a better democratic model for us here in Wales, but we face immediate problems around fundamentals like housing and healthcare that cannot wait for that outcome.
Even in these reduced circumstances, however, we are supposed to have some mechanism for influencing the decisions made on our behalf.
Most of us, of course, never influence Westminster politics with our votes. The first-past-the-post system means that casting a ballot in safe constituencies is largely symbolic. Again though, changing that would be the work of decades.
What Iâ€™m addressing here is the system as it is sold to us: the monarchical, Anglocentric, gerrymandered farce of democracy that we are too apathetic to overthrow. Howâ€™s that going; on its own terms?
Well, by my reckoning, we havenâ€™t received even the appearance of a democratic outcome to an election since 2005. Tony Blairâ€™s victory that year came with the caveat that heâ€™d finally be handing over the reins to Gordon Brown, because leadership of the nation is the sort of thing decided in an Islington restaurant, rather than a General Election.
At least we knew about that, though. In 2010, after the financial crisis had turned Brown into
Admiral Doenitz, we greeted the Conservative/Lib-Dem coalition.
Electoral reform
The creation of this government involved the hasty drafting of a programme of government for which nobody at all had voted. Laughably, it included provision for a referendum on electoral reform which David Cameronâ€™s party was not required to support.
2015â€™s election brought a Conservative majority at the cost of the Brexit referendum which swiftly saw off Cameron. Then we had Theresa May with no mandate, Theresa May with the DUP, Boris Johnson with no mandate, Boris Johnson in coalition with Covid-19, Liz Truss with no mandate, and Rishi Sunak with no mandate.
In the midst of all this, some people clung desperately to the Brexit vote as evidence of democracy enduring. Even for them, though, it must be a stretch.
To keep that show on the road, the UK government has effectively reunified Ireland and created so many vocational exceptions to the restriction on freedom of movement that you could be forgiven for suspecting theyâ€™re not quite as averse to immigration as they make out.
Caution
All of this means that Keir Starmerâ€™s anxiety to demonstrate caution in the run-up to next yearâ€™s election may prove to be reckless in the medium term.
So far, we have had three Keirs. There was the enthusiastic Europhile of Jeremy Corbynâ€™s Shadow Cabinet, the sensible radical who ran for the leadership, and now the Brexit convert who eschews left-wing economics, cleaves to Government foreign policy and is scaling back commitments on the environment and constitutional reform.
Labour enthusiasts tend to nod and wink that heâ€™ll pivot left again once heâ€™s safely elected. How do they think that will go?
People have been voting for governments that bear no relation to what they offered for nearly 20 years. Brexit not only failed to deliver economic results, but hasnâ€™t satisfied those voters who wanted, for whatever reason, to stem immigration and assert UK sovereignty. Democracy is seemingly divorced from the mechanism of Government altogether.
The starkest UK example of this was the defenestration by the bond markets of Liz Truss and Kwasi Kwarteng. Although only tangentially connected to an election result, they did, at least, hold offices of state in a country that claims to be democratic.
Those responsible for their removal, necessary as it was, were faceless speculators.
Abroad, meanwhile, Russia and China have ceased to pay lip service to democracy at all, whilst the ruling families of the Gulf prosper with little internal dissent.
Insurrection
Finally, we face the prospect of Donald Trump returning to power in the USA having openly incited insurrection and baldly promising to override any democratic institutions that hinder his will.
Next yearâ€™s general election will, paradoxically, be our most acrimonious, whilst offering the narrowest ideological choice we have ever seen.
Fury will erupt around gender and immigration issues, but the major parties offer no meaningful change to the economic status quo. Democracy has become low-rent entertainment.
Voters get to vent their frustration on carefully ring-fenced fringe issues while the juggernaut of international finance motors on regardless, stripping our public services and administering our lives by stealth.
It may be that democracy has exhausted itself. Perhaps we are too mistrustful and cynical to demand vibrancy from it anymore. But as the Welsh Labour Party prepares to offer its members a choice between two versions of Drakeford Lite, and Keir Starmer surveys the car crash of 2023 Britain only to prescribe an aspirin, theyâ€™d be unwise to rely on our apathy lasting forever.
The Trumpish overtures of Reform UK have their own TV channel in GB News and the Tory press at their service once Sunak is defeated. They will be reminding everyone that along with Powellite rhetoric on race, they promise to raise the threshold for income tax to Â£20 000 per year.
In its wariness, the left across the UK is playing a dangerous game.

author: Murcia.com
title: El IMAS convoca programas de empleabilidad que benefician a mÃ¡s de 4.000 personas en riesgo de exclusiÃ³n social - Sociedad - murcia.com
text: La ConsejerÃ­a de PolÃ­tica Social, Familias e Igualdad, a travÃ©s del Instituto Murciano de AcciÃ³n Social (IMAS) ha dotado con 8,5 millones de euros la convocatoria de subvenciones para el desarrollo de proyectos que fomenten la empleabilidad y la inclusiÃ³n activa de las personas y jÃ³venes en situaciÃ³n de vulnerabilidad. Esta lÃ­nea de ayudas estÃ¡ dirigida a entidades del Tercer Sector que promuevan itinerarios personalizados de acceso al mercado laboral cuyos resultados obtenidos hasta el momento alcanzan mÃ¡s del 30 por ciento de las inserciones laborales y la mejora de la cualificaciÃ³n de mÃ¡s del 25 por ciento de los participantes. La convocatoria, publicada hoy en el BoletÃ­n Oficial de la RegiÃ³n de Murcia, beneficiarÃ¡ a mÃ¡s 4.000 personas, se desarrolla en el marco del Programa FSE+ 2021-2027 y estÃ¡ financiada en un 60 por ciento por el Fondo Social Europeo y el 40 por ciento restante con fondos propios de la Comunidad. Los proyectos podrÃ¡n desarrollarse entre el 1 de abril de 2024 y el 31 de diciembre de 2025, con una duraciÃ³n mÃ¡xima de 21 meses, y podrÃ¡n hacerlo bajo cuatro tipologÃ­as diferentes: los programas comarcales, con un mÃ¡ximo de financiaciÃ³n de 268.000 euros; los dirigidos a dos territorios, con una subvenciÃ³n de hasta 229.000 euros; asÃ­ como los programas de un solo Ã¡mbito de actuaciÃ³n e institucionales, dotados con 195.000 y 150.000 euros, respectivamente. El IMAS, dentro de su plan de atenciÃ³n preferente a las personas en situaciÃ³n de vulnerabilidad social que precisan apoyos para lograr un empleo en condiciones de equidad, incluye en esta convocatoria actuaciones de mejora competencial de la persona, asesoramiento y un acompaÃ±amiento integral tÃ©cnico para facilitar su incorporaciÃ³n laboral. Una iniciativa que permitirÃ¡ mantener los 71 dispositivos de acciÃ³n social para la mejora de la empleabilidad que se estÃ¡n desarrollando actualmente en todo el territorio regional. Estos itinerarios individualizados de inclusiÃ³n activa se realizarÃ¡n de forma coordinada con los Servicios Sociales, de Empleo y los agentes implicados en los procesos de formaciÃ³n y empleo del territorio o Ã¡mbito de actuaciÃ³n. El plazo de presentaciÃ³n de solicitudes finaliza el 22 de enero de 2024.

author: Reuters
title: Ukrainian Catholic church says document on blessing same-sex couples does not apply â€“ ThePrint â€“ ReutersFeed
text:
Home World Ukrainian Catholic church says document on blessing same-sex couples does not apply World Ukrainian Catholic church says document on blessing same-sex couples does not apply Reuters 24 December, 2023 04:45 am IST WhatsApp Text Size: A- A+
(Reuters) â€“ The head of Ukraineâ€™s eastern-rite Catholic church on Saturday said a document endorsed by Pope Francis this week permitting blessings for same-sex couples did not apply to his church and its teachings.
Major Archbishop Sviatoslav Shevchuk said the Vatican document â€œinterprets the pastoral meaning of blessings in the Latin Churchâ€ but made no reference to issues governing the eastern, or Greek Catholic, church.
â€œThus â€¦ this Declaration applies solely to the Latin Church and has no legal force for the faithful of the Ukrainian Greek Catholic Church,â€ Shevchuk said in a statement.
Show Full Article
He said a blessing could not be separated from the churchâ€™s teachings and â€œcan in no way contradict the teaching of the Catholic Church about the family as a faithful, indissoluble, and fertile union of love between a man and a woman.â€
The eastern-rite church worships according to rites similar to the Orthodox faith, but is in communion with Rome by virtue of a 16th century agreement. Repression forced the church underground in Soviet times and it now has about 4.5 million parishioners, or roughly 10% of the population of Ukraine.
The document from the Vaticanâ€™s doctrinal office said Roman Catholic priests can administer blessings to same-sex couples as long as they are not part of regular church rituals or liturgies.
It said such blessings would be a sign that God welcomes all but should not be confused with the sacrament of heterosexual marriage.
Gay rights are making some progress in Ukraine and other ex-Soviet states outside Russia. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy has expressed sympathy for upholding gay rights, though ruling out constitutional changes to allow single-sex marriages while the country is at war.
(This story has been corrected to say â€˜same-sex couples,â€™ not â€˜same-sex marriage,â€™ in the headline)
(Reporting by Ron Popeski; Editing by Chris Reese)
Disclaimer: This report is auto generated from the Reuters news service. ThePrint holds no responsibilty for its content.

author: O Liberal
title: VÃDEO: De moto, cachorro com capacete chama atenÃ§Ã£o nas ruas | Brasil | O Liberal
text:
VÃDEO: De moto, cachorro com capacete chama atenÃ§Ã£o nas ruas
Animal foi flagrado de carona em uma moto, garantindo reaÃ§Ãµes divertidas na internet
Um vÃ­deo gravado em Belo Horizonte, Minas Gerais, estÃ¡ dando o que falar. Nele, um cachorro aparece sentado na garupa de uma moto, usando um capacete, enquanto acompanha seu tutor pelas ruas da cidade. A cena, alÃ©m de inusitada, gerou uma onda de comentÃ¡rios bem-humorados nas redes sociais.
Com mais de 4,4 milhÃµes de visualizaÃ§Ãµes, o vÃ­deo rapidamente conquistou os internautas. Um dos comentÃ¡rios mais curtidos foi: â€œO cachorro: Cleito, nÃ£o Ã© nessa rua nÃ£oâ€, enquanto outro usuÃ¡rio brincou: â€œSÃ³ acredito vendo: ðŸ¤¨ Vendo, e nÃ£o acreditando: ðŸ˜µâ€.
VEJA MAIS
Apesar do tom leve e das risadas, a cena tambÃ©m levantou debates sobre seguranÃ§a ao transportar animais em veÃ­culos. De toda forma, o cachorro de capacete jÃ¡ Ã© um personagem marcante entre os vÃ­deos do momento e segue divertindo milhares de pessoas.

author: Felicitas Hadad
title: Infancias conectadas: Â¿quÃ© tan grave es? - Infobae
text:
La conversaciÃ³n - Infancias conectadas Durante un taller en una escuela secundaria, la pregunta sorprende: â€œÂ¿A quiÃ©n le gustarÃ­a usar menos el celular?â€. La mayorÃ­a levanta la mano. El malestar digital ya no es solo cosa de adultos. A lo largo de casi 30 minutos de conversaciÃ³n en Infobae , tres voces expertas â€“la psiquiatra Geraldine Peronace, la especialista en educaciÃ³n de UNICEF Cora Steinberg y la consultora en ciudadanÃ­a digital LucÃ­a Fainboim â€“ coinciden en algo elemental, pero urgente: el uso problemÃ¡tico de las pantallas no es un fenÃ³meno aislado, y sus consecuencias sobre la salud mental y la sociabilidad infantil ya son tangibles.
Este artÃ­culo forma parte de La ConversaciÃ³n , el nuevo ciclo audiovisual de Infobae disponible en YouTube, que propone abrir el debate sobre temÃ¡ticas complejas que atraviesan a la Argentina. Se trata de un espacio de conversaciÃ³n reflexiva moderado por Gonzalo SÃ¡nchez , donde, en cada episodio, expertos, investigadores, activistas o referentes comparten su mirada sobre un tema de interÃ©s social, polÃ­tico o econÃ³mico. Los episodios estarÃ¡n disponibles todos los jueves en el canal de YouTube de Infobae . En esta ediciÃ³n, el foco estÃ¡ puesto en el vÃ­nculo entre infancias, adolescencias y el mundo digital.
SegÃºn una reciente encuesta nacional de UNICEF Argentina, el 46% de los niÃ±os y adolescentes reconoce tener un vÃ­nculo problemÃ¡tico con el uso de tecnologÃ­a . â€œLo dicen ellos. Es una encuesta autoadministrada. Responden solos que sienten que les impacta en la escuela y en el descansoâ€, seÃ±ala Steinberg. No son diagnÃ³sticos adultocÃ©ntricos: es un grito de auxilio de los propios protagonistas.
El periodista Gonzalo SÃ¡nchez junto a la psiquiatra Geraldine Peronace, la especialista en educaciÃ³n de UNICEF Cora Steinberg y la consultora en ciudadanÃ­a digital LucÃ­a Fainboim Un celular a los 9 aÃ±os, una puerta abierta sin adultos El promedio de edad para el primer celular con Internet en Argentina es 9,6 aÃ±os. â€œMÃ¡s del 83% de los chicos ya accede a su primer dispositivo entre los 9 y los 11 aÃ±osâ€, advierte Steinberg. Y con Ã©l, se abre un mundo de vÃ­nculos, estÃ­mulos y riesgos que, muchas veces, transitan sin acompaÃ±amiento. â€œHoy Internet es un espacio mÃ¡s que ellos habitan, como el club o la escuela. Pero a diferencia de esos lugares, no hay adultos mirÃ¡ndolosâ€, explica Fainboim.
El auge de la inteligencia artificial y las redes sociales intensifica el debate sobre el aprendizaje y la salud mental de los jÃ³venes (Imagen ilustrativa Infobae) El problema no son solo las horas frente a la pantalla (que, en promedio, ascienden a 8 horas y 40 minutos por dÃ­a), sino lo que se consume en ese tiempo. â€œTenemos chicos de seis aÃ±os mirando pornografÃ­a, otros participando en desafÃ­os virales que los han llevado a la muerte, y otros contactados por adultos que se hacen pasar por menores. Eso es contenido, conducta y contacto: los tres grandes riesgosâ€, resume Peronace.
No son nativos digitales, son aprendices sin guÃ­a Uno de los conceptos mÃ¡s discutidos por los especialistas es el de â€œnativos digitalesâ€ . Fainboim, que lidera la organizaciÃ³n Bienestar Digital, lo desarma con claridad: â€œDecimos que por haber nacido en esta Ã©poca ya tienen habilidades, pero lo que vemos es que no tienen ni habilidades operativas ni reflexivas. Para eso nos necesitanâ€. El acceso temprano no equivale a comprensiÃ³n ni a criterio.
A falta de mediaciÃ³n adulta, la lÃ³gica de las plataformas se impone. â€œSi un chico ve un video sobre cÃ³mo adelgazar, toda la semana le van a ofrecer ese tipo de contenido. Y en segundo lugar, buscan cÃ³mo ganar dinero. Esos son los principales consumos segÃºn la encuestaâ€, alerta Steinberg. En ese combo, la autoestima, la imagen corporal y la percepciÃ³n del Ã©xito quedan atrapadas en algoritmos sin empatÃ­a.
La dopamina como trampa Lo que parece inofensivo â€“un rato de TikTok, un poco de YouTubeâ€“ puede tener consecuencias biolÃ³gicas profundas. â€œCuando un chico no se aburre, no puede activar esa parte del cerebro que se relaciona con la creatividadâ€ , explica Peronace. En su lugar, el cerebro entra en â€œrumiaciÃ³nâ€: pensamientos obsesivos, repetitivos y negativos, que incrementan el riesgo de depresiÃ³n, autolesiones y suicidio.
â€œEn la clÃ­nica estamos viendo cuadros que antes asociÃ¡bamos a consumo crÃ³nico de marihuana, y que hoy se explican por mÃ¡s de 11 horas diarias de pantalla. Ansiedad, desconexiÃ³n afectiva, pÃ©rdida de memoria, aplanamiento emocionalâ€, describe la psiquiatra.
Los chicos empiezan a darse cuenta Un dato esperanzador emerge entre tanta preocupaciÃ³n: â€œCuando hacemos talleres en secundaria y preguntamos quiÃ©n quiere usar menos el celular, ahora levantan la mano todosâ€, cuenta Fainboim. Incluso los adolescentes que accedieron al celular a los 9 aÃ±os o antes tienen una mirada crÃ­tica: â€œDicen que vieron contenido perturbador, que se perdieron experiencias importantes. Se dan cuentaâ€ , agrega.
La 'podredumbre cerebral' preocupa a mÃ©dicos y padres por el impacto del consumo excesivo de contenido digital (Imagen Ilustrativa Infobae) La urgencia, entonces, no es prohibir sino acompaÃ±ar. â€œCuando hay mayor presencia adulta, cuando hay mediaciÃ³n, baja significativamente el riesgo de que se conecten con desconocidos, hagan apuestas online o sufran groomingâ€, afirma Steinberg.
Â¿Y quÃ© hacemos los adultos? Muchos padres, reconocen los expertos, usamos el celular como estrategia de supervivencia. â€œNos resulta cÃ³modo el niÃ±o conectado porque nos da un rato de descanso. Pero ya no alcanza con pensar que si estÃ¡ en casa estÃ¡ seguroâ€, plantea Fainboim. La idea de que â€œsi no estÃ¡ en la calle, estÃ¡ bienâ€ quedÃ³ obsoleta: el peligro estÃ¡ tambiÃ©n en el living.
Peronace es contundente: â€œEl â€˜noâ€™ se aprende en casa. Y si no lo enseÃ±amos nosotros, despuÃ©s no vamos a poder hacerlo cuando tenga 13 aÃ±os y quiera tomar whisky o fumar porro . Empieza con el celularâ€.
EducaciÃ³n emocional y presencia real MÃ¡s allÃ¡ del tiempo frente a las pantallas, el desafÃ­o estÃ¡ en las habilidades que los chicos deben desarrollar por fuera de ellas. â€œEmpatÃ­a, oralidad, comprensiÃ³n lectora, capacidad de aburrirse, de frustrarse. Todo eso se aprende en la interacciÃ³n cara a caraâ€, dice Fainboim.
El excesivo uso de pantallas afectarÃ­a a los jÃ³venes en el desarrollo de sus capacidades emocionales (Imagen Ilustrativa Infobae) Y para eso se necesita tiempo compartido, en la presencia y en la palabra. No se trata de desaparecer cuando se prende la pantalla. â€œVeamos una peli juntos, pongamos reglas: que el contenido tenga inicio, desarrollo y final, que dure al menos 15 minutos.
